did.unittitle: Office of the University President - Record Group 3

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Washington and Lee University. Office of the President

did.langmaterial: The materials in this collection are in English.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This record group contains materials created by the University's Presidents while carrying out their job duties.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is generally open for research use. Some materials may be restricted.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials from Washington and Lee University Special Collections are made available for use in research, teaching, and private study, pursuant to U.S. Copyright law. The user assumes full responsibility for any use of the materials, including but not limited to, infringement of copyright and publication rights of reproduced materials. Any materials used should be fully credited with the source. Permission for publication of this material, in part or in full, must be secured with the Head of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Preferred citation: [Identification of item], Record Group 3: Office of the University President, Special Collections and Archives, James G. Leyburn Library, Washington and Lee University, Lexington, VA
In some cases the citation format may vary. Please contact Special Collections' staff to verify the appropriate format.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This box contains materials on the following Corporafoundations,funds and trusts: Bonner,Carmaxx,Carpenter,Chicago Community,Christian A.Johnson Endeavor,Clarke Winchole,Commonwealth,DuPont,Dyson,EDFUND,Evans,Freuauff,Getty,Goodrich,Kenan,Kendal,Kerr,Knight,Liebman,Luce,Marshall,Mellon,Milhauser,Morris,Rawls,Pew,Reynolds,Stonewall Jackson,Telford,Watson,and Williams. Also pre-2005 Greek system, pre-2005 HR,pre-2005 Law School,five year plan, law class of 2007.

did.unittitle: African Americans at Washington and Lee website

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A timeline is being developed on the university website by a special working group established in August 2013 by Washington and Lee President Kenneth P. Ruscio to explore the role of African Americans in the history of the University. The University Library is capturing this timeline using Archive-It.

altformavail.head: Online Access
altformavail.p: View captures online at Washington and Lee University's Archive-It webpage
